title: High Dependency on Unpaid Child Labor
description: In 2015, 63.7% of children aged 7-14 in employment were unpaid family workers, highlighting a significant reliance on unpaid child labor.

title: Significant Child Employment in Study and Work
description: In 2015, 95.96% of children aged 7-14 in employment were engaged in both study and work, indicating a high level of child labor involvement.

title: Low Goods and Services Expense
description: In 2023, Brazil's goods and services expense was only 2.41% of total expenses, one of the lowest globally.

title: High Adequacy of Unemployment Benefits
description: In 2022, unemployment benefits and active labor market programs accounted for 27.07% of the total welfare of beneficiary households, showcasing a strong social safety net.

title: Negative Net National Savings
description: In 2021, Brazil's adjusted savings were negative, amounting to -$15.9 billion, indicating financial challenges in national savings.

title: High Bond Issuance
description: In 2023, Brazil issued bonds worth $3.4 billion, reflecting a strong presence in the global bond market.
